oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A synergistic approach to polycyclics via a strategic utilization of Claisen rearrangement and olefin metathesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
KRISHNA, NG
HALDER, S
MISRA, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: RING-CLOSING METATHESIS
FORMAL TOTAL-SYNTHESIS
RCM REACTION SEQUENCE
STEREOSELECTIVE-SYNTHESIS
CATALYTIC METATHESIS
ACID-DERIVATIVES
AMINO-ACID
KEY STEPS
FUNCTIONALIZED CARBOCYCLES
REGIOSELECTIVE SYNTHESIS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Olefin metathesis promoted by a well-defined metal carbene complex has evolved into an efficient method for the construction of a broad range of carbocyclic and heterocyclic rings of varying size. The synthetic potential of the olefin metathesis has been further increased by combining various other C-C bond forming processes either in tandem or in sequence. Herein, application of Claisen rearrangement and olefin metathesis to prepare various intricate and/or biologically important targets has been described.
